articles.content:
Opening of "Rally on Human Rights Issue in North" Assailed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions in a statement issued on Dec. 6 bitterly denounced the opening of "a rally on the human rights issue in the north". The propaganda over "human rights issue" is a trite method employed by the U.S. for carrying out its strategy for global domination, it noted.
 Strongly demanding an immediate halt to the above-said rally as it is going against the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula, the statement urged the U.S. to withdraw its hostile policy toward the DPRK as quickly as possible.    
 The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in a statement released on the same day asserted that there should be an international rally to condemn the human rights abuses of the U.S. and the Grand National Party in Seoul. It underscored the need to open to the public all the savage violations of human rights committed by the U.S. and the pro-American conservative forces and certainly force them to pay for them.

articles.title: Solidarity Resolution on Korea Adopted at 15th Congress of WFTU
EU's Partial Behavior under Fire
articles.content:
Solidarity Resolution on Korea Adopted at 15th Congress of WFTU 
    Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A resolution protesting against the U.S. imperialists' political pressure and economic sanctions and  military moves for aggression against the DPRK was adopted at the 15th Congress of the World Federation of Trade Unions in Havana on Dec 4. 
 The congress recognizes that the political pressure, economic sanctions and military moves for aggression and other crimes perpetrated by the U.S. against the Korean people over the last six decades since its military occupation of a half of Korea after the end of the Second World War have seriously threatened not only peace and security on the Korean Peninsula but also  peace and security in the rest of the world, it noted.    
 The resolution demanded the U.S. withdraw its aggression forces from south Korea as required by the resolution adopted at the 30th UN General Assembly and urged by all Koreans in the north and the south and sincerely fulfill its commitments on the principle of "words for words" and "action for action" laid down in the joint statement adopted at the forth round of the six-party talks on the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula.
